meanings.definition: A ladder or set of steps.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter quickly climbed the echelles to rescue the cat from the tree.
meanings.sent2: He used the echelles to reach the top shelf in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The echelles in the library seemed to lead to a magical world of books.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition was the echelles to success, with each step representing a milestone.
meanings.sent5: The echelles creaked under the weight of the heavy boxes.

meanings.sent1: The echelles of colors on the paint chart helped him choose the perfect shade.
meanings.sent2: The echelles of difficulty in the game increased as he progressed.
meanings.sent3: The echelles of spiciness in the chili made his taste buds dance.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions ran the echelles from joy to sorrow within minutes.
meanings.sent5: The echelles of prices at the store ranged from affordable to extravagant.

meanings.sent1: The musician practiced the echelles on the piano to improve her skills.
meanings.sent2: The echelles of notes in the song created a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent3: The echelles of sounds from the orchestra filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: Her voice effortlessly glided through the echelles during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The echelles of harmonies blended perfectly in the choir's rendition.

meanings.definition: A series of lines used in surveying.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor carefully followed the echelles to map out the land.
meanings.sent2: The echelles on the map helped him determine the property boundaries.
meanings.sent3: The echelles drawn on the blueprint guided the construction of the new building.
meanings.sent4: His precision in following the echelles ensured accurate measurements.
meanings.sent5: The echelles on the surveying equipment made his job easier.
